name: Atwater, John C.
title: Co-Founder and Managing Partner; Co-Chairman and CEO
political_donations: $5,400 in political contributions for 2016 cycle per FEC records
ngos: California Academy of Sciences (Board Chair 2010-2014); Corporation of Brown University; Policy Advisory Board of the Fisher Center for Real Estate and Urban Economics, UC Berkeley; The Hamlin School; Lone Mountain School for Children
notes: Founded Prime Group in 1989, a real estate firm managing over $20 billion in assets. Graduate of Brown University and Stanford Graduate School of Business.

name: Callander, Clark N.
title: Co-Founder and Managing Partner
ngos: Napster Corp. (Chairman of the Board); Sugar Bowl Resort (Chairman)
notes: Previously co-founded GCA (TSE: 2174), a technology-focused global M&A advisory firm, in 2003. Prior career at Robertson Stephens & Company (1993-2002) and PaineWebber. Stanford University undergraduate; MBA from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.

name: Denham, William F. 'Billy Valentine'
notes: Born William Denham in West Virginia, raised in Columbus, Ohio. Professional musician and singer performing as Billy Valentine. Recorded the theme song for the network TV series Boston Legal (2004-2008). Grammy, Emmy, and ACM nominated songwriter. Studio musician heard on themes for The Office, My Name Is Earl, and other television productions. Member of The Valentine Brothers.

name: Doll, Dixon Raymond
title: Co-Founder and Partner Emeritus
ngos: National Venture Capital Association (Board member 2005; Executive Committee; Chairman 2008-2009); Ten Eleven Ventures (Advisor)
notes: Pioneer venture capitalist who co-founded DCM Ventures (formerly Doll Capital Management) in 1996, one of the first Silicon Valley VC firms to successfully invest in China, Japan, and the US. Previously co-founded the VC industry's first telecom-focused fund at Accel Partners. Named to Forbes Midas List for four consecutive years. Received NVCA Lifetime Achievement Award in Venture Capital in 2021. Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering from University of Michigan.

name: Fisher, John J.
title: President
political_donations: Substantial Republican donor; $247,000 to McCarthy Victory Fund (2018 cycle); $5 million to conservative dark money group (2010-2012); top individual contributor to Republican candidates per FEC records
ngos: KIPP Public Charter Schools (board); San Jose Earthquakes (co-owner, MLS); Celtic FC (stakeholder)
notes: Son of Gap Inc. co-founders Donald and Doris Fisher. Majority owner and managing general partner of the Athletics (MLB), previously Oakland A's, now Las Vegas. Also owns stake in San Jose Earthquakes (MLS) and Celtic FC. Graduate of Princeton University (A.B. history, 1983) and Stanford GSB (MBA). Net worth estimated at ~$3 billion.

name: Grayson, William Ellison
title: National Director, Family Offices
ngos: Presidio Trust Board of Directors (Chair, 2019-2021; member from 2017); UC Berkeley Institute of Governmental Studies; Woodrow Wilson International Center for Scholars; President's Commission on White House Fellowships; Dominican University of California; University of San Francisco School of Law; Archdiocese of San Francisco; Bay Area Discovery Museum
notes: Attorney and investment executive. Served as Principal Deputy General Counsel of the Army under President George H.W. Bush, overseeing 2,700 lawyers. Appointed by President Trump to Presidio Trust Board (2017), elected Board Chair (2019). Nominated and confirmed as U.S. Ambassador to Estonia (2020-2021). Previous roles at J.P. Morgan and Montgomery Securities. B.A. UC Santa Barbara; J.D. University of San Francisco School of Law.

name: Guggenhime, Richard J.
title: Senior Counsel
ngos: Stanley S. Langendorf Foundation (President); San Francisco Opera Association (Executive Committee, Past Director); San Francisco University High School Board of Trustees (Past Chair); St. Ignatius College Preparatory School Board of Regents; State Compensation Insurance Fund (Board of Directors)
notes: Trusts and estates attorney practicing since 1966. Harvard Law School graduate (1964). San Francisco civic leader: served on City Airport Commission (2006-2022), Fire Commission (1985-1989), Board of Permit Appeals (1978-1985), Recreation and Park Commission (1989-1993, 2004-2005). Listed in Best Lawyers in America (2024-2026) and Super Lawyers Northern California.

name: Hebert, Victor A.
title: Managing Director, Chief Administrative Officer, and Chief Legal Officer
notes: Business attorney with extensive M&A, corporate finance, and venture capital experience. Previously at Heller Ehrman LLP where he served as Chairman of the Management Committee (1981-1993) and Co-Chairman (1987-1993). Joined Burrill & Company in 2008 as chief legal officer. In 2016, the SEC settled enforcement proceedings against him for misappropriating approximately $18 million from Burrill Capital Sciences Capital Fund III; Hebert was fined $185,000, permanently suspended from appearing before the SEC as an attorney, and accepted an industry ban. Undergraduate and law degrees from UC Berkeley.

name: Hoffman, Robert Butler
notes: Corporate finance executive (born December 11, 1936, Ithaca, NY). Career included: CFO at W.R. Grace & Company (Pacific and European divisions, 1964-1975); CFO at Federal Maritime Commission Corporation (1975-1984); EVP/CFO at Castle & Cooke Inc. (1984); EVP/CFO at Staley Continental Inc., Chicago (1985-1988); SVP/CFO at Monsanto Company, St. Louis (1994-1997); Vice Chairman at Monsanto (1997-1999); Chairman of Harnischfeger Industries Inc. (1999-2000). B.A. Geology, Cornell University (1958); MBA Harvard University (1964).

name: Jackson, D. Dana
title: Managing Director, Jackson Capital Group
notes: Senior wealth management executive based in Menlo Park, California. Started career at Kidder Peabody before moving to Morgan Stanley over 30 years ago. Elected to Barron's Hall of Fame for Advisors in 2019 (recognizing 10+ years on Barron's Top 100 Advisors list). Named Forbes Best-In-State Wealth Management Team (California) 2025. Leads Jackson Capital Group serving VCs, founders, and family offices.

name: Jarman, Claude
notes: Claude Miller Jarman Jr. (September 27, 1934 - January 12, 2025). Child actor who starred as Jody Baxter in The Yearling (1946), for which he received a special Academy Juvenile Award. Retired from acting in early adulthood. Later career: Executive Director of the San Francisco International Film Festival (1965-1980); Director of Cultural Affairs for the City of San Francisco under Mayor Joseph Alioto (from 1974). Founded Jarman Travel Inc. in 1986. Died at his home in Kentfield, California, at age 90.

name: Johnson, Robert W. IV
title: Chairman and CEO
political_donations: Major Republican donor; donated $1.5 million to Trump presidential campaigns and inaugural committee by August 2019; $575,000 to Trump 2020 re-election committee (February 2020); $355,000 to RNC; previously national finance chairman for Jeb Bush (2015-2016)
ngos: Alliance for Lupus Research (founder, 1999); New York Jets (owner and chairman)
notes: Great-grandson of Robert Wood Johnson I, founder of Johnson & Johnson. Known as 'Woody' Johnson. Purchased New York Jets (NFL) for $635 million with brother Christopher in 2000. Served as U.S. Ambassador to the United Kingdom (2017-2021) appointed by President Trump. Net worth estimated at ~$9.92 billion (Bloomberg, April 2024). Graduate of the University of Arizona.

name: Kennedy, Gregory Davis
title: Founder and Managing Partner
ngos: The Windward School (Board member); Komera (supporter, education for young women in Rwanda)
notes: Son of U.S. Supreme Court Justice Anthony M. Kennedy and Mary Davis Kennedy. Fifth-generation Californian born in Sacramento. Attended Jesuit High School, Sacramento. B.A. and J.D. from Stanford University. Law clerk to U.S. Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit. Practiced law at Sullivan & Cromwell (New York, from 1992). Senior investment banker at UBS, Barclays, Credit Suisse, and Morgan Stanley. Founded Advection Growth Capital in 2017. Died January 18, 2025, of cardiac arrest at age 58.

name: Lainovic, Sacha
title: Co-Founder and Managing Partner
ngos: Metropolitan Museum of Art (Trustee, elected 2018); Hospital for Special Surgery (Board); Stanford Graduate School of Business Advisory Council
notes: Co-founded The Invus Group LLC (global private equity firm) and served as Executive Vice President (1985-2006), then co-founded Invus Financial Advisors. Earlier career as management consultant at The Boston Consulting Group in Paris. M.S. from INSA de Lyon; MBA from Stanford University.

name: Larson, John W.
ngos: San Francisco Chamber of Commerce (Board of Directors; Chairman 1996); California Academy of Sciences; Bay Area Council
notes: Retired attorney (born June 24, 1935, Detroit, MI). Partner at Brobeck, Phleger & Harrison, San Francisco (1968-2003 with interruption); CEO of Brobeck (1988-1996). Served as Assistant Secretary of the U.S. Department of the Interior (1971-1973) and Counselor to the Chairman of the Cost of Living Council (1973). Partner at Morgan, Lewis & Bockius LLP (2003-2009). Stanford University B.A. (with distinction, 1957) and Stanford Law School LLB (1962). Listed in Super Lawyers Northern California (2004-2009).

name: MacCaskill, Paul L.
title: Founder and Chairman of the Board
notes: Over 40 years of experience designing nonqualified executive benefit plans for ultra-affluent and corporate markets. Founding shareholder of The M Financial Group, a premier financial services design and distribution company. Managing Director and shareholder of Pen-Cal Administrators (2004-2018), a leading nonqualified plan financing and administration provider. B.S. in Business and Accounting from University of Southern California (1966-1970).

name: Magnuson, Richard A.
title: Founder and Executive Managing Director
notes: Founded GI Partners in 2001 (private equity firm focused on data infrastructure and technology). Co-founder and Chairman Emeritus of Digital Realty Trust, Inc. (NYSE: DLR). Prior career at Nomura Principal Finance Group, London (Deputy Managing Director, 1994-2001) and Merrill Lynch (Director of Investment Banking). Earlier founded and sold Interactive Software. Charter member of the San Francisco Bay YPO chapter. B.A. Dartmouth College; MBA Stanford Graduate School of Business.

name: Mondavi, Michael
title: Founder and Chairman
ngos: Wine Market Council (past Chairman/CEO); Napa Valley Vintners (past Chairman); California Wine Institute (past Chairman); Winegrowers of California (past Chairman); Michael Mondavi Family Estate
notes: Son of Robert Mondavi; co-founded Robert Mondavi Winery with his father in 1966. Served as winemaker (1966-1974), VP Sales (1969-1978), Managing Director and CEO (1990-2001), and Chairman (2001-2004) of Robert Mondavi Corporation. Co-founded Folio Fine Wine Partners in 2004; EPI took majority stake in 2020 while Michael retained Chairman role. Also established Michael Mondavi Family Estate (Atlas Peak, Napa Valley, purchased 1999).

name: Ruehl, Ernest H. Jr.
title: Partner
notes: Investment banker with over 30 years of technology sector advisory experience, specializing in the semiconductor industry. Career: Managing Director at Goldman Sachs; Managing Director then Vice Chairman and Head of Americas Technology Group at Credit Suisse (20+ years); retained by UBS Group following Credit Suisse acquisition (2023); joined PJT Partners (2023). MBA from Stanford Graduate School of Business; undergraduate degree from Princeton University.
